qwellcode_projects.name: Zeroone Platform
qwellcode_projects.description: 4.5 million digital assets from over 180,000 creators enabling users to form collectives. Actively developed by @qwellcode with ongoing involvement.

qwellcode_projects.name: Amber Island
qwellcode_projects.description: Web3-based whisky membership community (2022) by GHARAGE/Heinemann. Users mint 'Amber Island Key' NFTs (0.15 ETH) to join, gaining access to tokenized whisky bottles (e.g., Glenturret 30YO, CryptoPunk Whisky), exclusive events, and community perks. Technology integrates Meta Anchor™ for authenticity and 3D-printed bottles for events. Currently on a 'strategic pause' due to market conditions, but existing memberships remain valid.

status_details.pause_reason: Challenging market conditions in spirits/blockchain sectors (2024). No new memberships sold; existing members can still redeem free CryptoPunk Whisky and access stored bottles.
status_details.future_outlook: Strategic pause with belief in future potential; no official resumption date as of late 2025.

qwellcode_projects.name: mocaOS
qwellcode_projects.description: Open-source OS for decentralized culture, including projects like the Museum of Crypto Art and Codex-Archive. Actively maintained by @qwellcode.

qwellcode_projects.name: POAP Protocol
qwellcode_projects.description: Pioneering project for digital memory and culture NFTs, active for 7+ years, developed by @qwellcode.

qwellcode_projects.name: Museum of Crypto Art (MoCA)
qwellcode_projects.description: Platform for crypto art and web3 culture, including 'mocaROOMs' and collaborations with artists like @untitledxyz_. Actively promoted by @qwellcode.

qwellcode_projects.name: AI & Language Models
qwellcode_projects.description: Research into on-premise AI assistants, including a German-speaking model using LeoLM 13B (built on Llama-2), and German document chatbots using h2ogpt.

qwellcode_projects.name: VR/AR & Immersive Experiences (Historical)
qwellcode_projects.description: Early focus (2017–2018) on WebVR tours (e.g., 360-degree explorations like Èze Village) and standalone HMD software for devices like Vive Focus. Worked on conferences like @nifty_hacks. No active development post-2018.
